SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Card
Abstract class that represents the cards
CardData
CardData is a "container" for a PlayableCard and its coordinates added when the card is played.
CardPlacedInfo
Class that represents information about a card that has been placed on the field
ChatThread
ChatThread is a class that manage the chat of the game
CLI
CLI/TUI class
ClientCommandInterpreter
This class parse the input to let the server do what's needed based on the type of connection of the client
ClientDATA
Class that contains all the data of the client
ClientInterface
This interface is implemented from the ClientRMI
ClientListener
ClientListener is a class that binds every tcp client to the TCPServer
ClientPingerThread
Thread that answer the ping of the thread
ClientRMI
This is the class for those clients who decide to connect via RMI
CLIENTSTARTER
This is the main client class that create the clients thread based on the connection chosen
ClientWriter
Class that works in parallel to "listen" the text from the user
Color
Enum of the color present in the game
ColorTakenException
Exception that is thrown when a pawn color is already taken
CommonClientInterface
Interface implemented by both TCPClient and ClientRMI
ControllerGameView
Controller of the GameScene
Coords
Coords is a class that allows to relate two integer as coordinates of a placed card.
Corner
Class Corner is used to keep track of the 8 angles of each card, 4 in the front and 4 in the back, with respective kingdom/item contained
DeckandHand
Class that contains the info of the hand of the player and the decks
DisconnectedException
Exception thrown if a client is disconnected
Draw
Interface to allow the draw from different type of decks
EmptyDeckException
Exception that is thrown when a deck is empty
EnteredCardControl
This class helps the Field class to count the 3 needed card for the placement procedure.
Field
This class contains the board data of each player.
FirstScreenContainer
 
Game
The Game class, dedicated to all and each game related actions and information
GameController
Controller class for a single Game
GameLauncher
 
GameNotFoundException
Exception thrown when searching for a Game that doesn't exist
GameThread
GameThread is the thread that allows the game to evolve, communicating with the client.
GoldCard
This class represents the gold cards with their parameters
GoldDeck
GoldDeck take the data from the json file e send them to the constructor of the starter cards
GUI
Class that represents the GUI and implements the method of the Viewable interface
GuiData
Class that contains data for the GUI
GuiListenerHolder
The class that allows the gui to change listeners for controllers
GuiPlacedConfirm
Class that contains the info of a card placed
GuiSupportApp
Application class that allow the GUI to run
Hand
The group of cards that the Players has (never more than 3)
Header
Class that allow the separation of every task both Server and Client side
ImageCard
Class that contains the info of a card displayed
ImplementerRmi
ImplementerRmi is a class () that contains the needed elements to let the server manage the connection of the client associated with the player.
ImplementerTCP
ImplementerTCP is a class () that contains the needed elements to let the server manage the connection of the client associated with the player.
InterfaceRMI
Interface implemented from ServerRMI
InvalidInputException
Exception that is thrown when the input given it's not valid (general)
LobbyManager
Manages all the Games available and the Players joining them
LockClass
Class used to synchronise all the clients
LoginController
Controller of the login-view
MConfirmedDraw
TCP classes to help send the information of a drawing update
MConfirmedPlacement
Class that allows the client to place the card in the spot chosen and update the score
MCoords
Class that allow the sending of coordinates inside Message Class
MDrawCard
Class that allow the sending of card data inside Message Class
Message
Message is a class that can be exchanged between clients servers.
MessageContent
MessageContent is an abstract class that uses polymorphism to send Message.
MObjViewSetup
Tcp Message that contains all the information for the choice of the objective
MPlayCard
Class that allow the sending of information about the played card inside Message Class
MPlayersData
MPlayersData allow to send the nickName controlled by the server and the other players name to the client
MPrivateChat
Class that allow the sending of private message inside Message Class
MReconnectionInfo
Class that allow the information of a game to travel to a reconnecting client
MSimpleString
Class that allow the sending of String inside Message Class
MStartSetup
Class used to send the 4 Nicknames of each Player and their randomly drawn StarterCards
NicknameTakenException
Exception that is thrown when a nickname is taken
NoPossiblePlacement
Exception thrown if the Coords chosen aren't valid/available
NotPlaceableException
Exception thrown if a card is not placeable in the coordinates chosen
NullNicknameException
Exception that is thrown when the nickname is null or empty
NumOfPlayersException
Exception that is thrown when the player number is not between 2 and 4
ObjChoiceController
Controller of the objChoice scene
ObjChoiceData
Class that contains all the data needed to choose the objective card
ObjectiveCard
This class represents the objective cards with their parameters
ObjectiveDeck
ObjectiveDeck take the data from the json file e send them to the constructor of the starter cards
Orientation
Direction useful to travel between cards
ParserTCP
ClientMessageSorter is a class that allow the division of the message came from the server
PlayableCard
This is the abstract class that represents the cards that the player could place in his field
Player
Class dedicated to represent each user that creates a session and can join a Game
PlayerDisconnectionResendInfo
Class that stores information needed to resend data to a player who has reconnected after a disconnection
ReferenceContainer
It contains all the references for threads so the garbage collector doesn't clear them.
ResourceCard
This class represents the resource cards with their parameters
ResourceDeck
ResourceDeck take the data from the json file e send them to the constructor of the starter cards
SceneController
Class that change the scenes during the game
Scope
This Enum Class lists all the type of request Client/Server of the TCP Message
ScoreBoard
Class dedicated to saving the score of every Player
ScorePlayers
Class that contains the score of the player
SERVER
This is the main class of the server that create both the serverTCP and the serverRMI
ServerMessageSorter
ServerMessageSorter is a queue that allows the player to send message (if they are allowed) and then the server can use this message for a specific task
ServerPingThread
Thread that starts the ping interaction and remove the connection of the client if it doesn't get a ping response
ServerProtocolInterface
Interface implemented from ImplementerRMI and ImplementerTCP to unify the action of the server with the clients
ServerRMI
This is the class that represents the server for RMI that communicate with GameThread in order to perform the commands
ServerTCP
ServerTCP Class
SetUpPhaseThread
SetUpPhaseThread is the class that make all the player choose the starter card facing, the color of the pawn and the personal objective card simultaneously
SetUpSceneController
Controller of the SetUpScene
SortPlayerThread
Thread that allow the connection of different clients simultaneously
StarterCard
This class represents the starter cards with their parameters
StarterChoiceData
Class that contains the info to choose the face of the starter card and the color of the pawn
StarterDeck
StarterDeck take the data from the json file e send them to the constructor of the starter cards
Symbol
Symbols used in the game
TCPClient
Class that represents the client TCP
TimerThread
Thread used as a timer to check if the client is still connected
TimerWinner
Thread used to check if there is only one player left in the game that become automatically the winner
Turnings
This enum is used to scan every phase of a player turn or moment
Viewable
Implemented by both CLI/TUI and GUI, contains all the methods they implement
VisibleElements
Visible is a Class that contains the number of all visible symbols presents on the field of each player
